reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Glad I Chose This One
reviews.reviewText: I read tons and tons of reviews for different marble runs before settling on this one. I agonized over the reviews that appeared on almost every different marble run, saying the pieces don't hold together and the structures fall apart. I ended up buying this one, despite a few negative reviews, and it works great! The pieces hold together very nicely, and my 7-year-old and almost-4-year-old love playing with it. When we first got it, they spent no less than 6 hours that day playing with it, and at least 4 hours a day for the next few days. It slowly petered out over a week or 2, and they gradually lost interest, but will still get it out every few weeks and play with it for an hour or so. Not bad for $40. I love that it comes with a handy, drawstring bag so we can pack it all away, all together, and the pieces don't get lost. It's also great that it came with so many marbles, because somehow those DO disappear, despite our best efforts. For the reviews saying structures fall over; this is not really a fault of the toy, in my experience. You do have to build with a little intelligence, setting the towers up in a triangular or square pattern (or any kind of staggered pattern, really) for stability, not all in a straight row, which would be easily knocked over. My kids learned this very quickly. My 7-year-old very quickly learned to build complex, fully functional structures. My almost-4-year-old likes to run the marbles down structures that someone else builds, or just play with the pieces, connecting and disconnecting them, sorting the colors, collecting and hoarding marbles, etc. He doesn't quite "get" the concept of making a functioning marble run on his own yet, but that is fine; both kids enjoy the toy a lot. Only 2 pieces in the whole set do not quite work properly; the two that look like curving roller-coaster tracks; they are just slightly warped, and the balls would stop running on them, so we stopped using them. All the rest work perfectly, and we are very happy with it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This was the best gift. I purchased it for my 4 year old niece who obviously struggled assembling it but was fascinated and had so much fun with it once built.What I learned quickly is that it's a lot of fun for older kids and adults because my 12yr old niece and I spent almost an hour and a half playing with it.Highly recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Meland Marble Run
reviews.reviewText: I bought this for my grandkids to work together putting it together, It took alot of times trying to put it together before they succeeded. It has to be placed on a flat hard surface or it tips over .There is no instruction sheet to help out. and their playing with it didn't seem to last long. They were at ages 10, 8,6 and now it sits in the closet. But your kids or grandkids may like it better.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great Set with minor complaints
reviews.reviewText: This was a holiday gift for my children, and they adore the set. The set came with visual instructions for 2 example marble runs, which was great for a new marble run enthusiast.I only have two complaints about the set. The glowing marbles are adorable, but they don't move through the run very well. They are slightly lighter in weight compared to regular marbles, and they are slightly larger than the other glass marbles.My second complaint is that a few of the smaller connector pieces are loose when fitted together; making some areas of the run less sturdy than others. My younger children get upset when some of the pieces fall off.Compared to other marble runs, it is a good set for the value I paid. I would purchase it again and may purchase a second set for larger projects.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars What a fun toy!
reviews.reviewText: I bought this set for my husband after he played it with our grandson at his house. So much fun to change the pieces and the lighted marbles are very cool. We'll be buying extensions for this.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A lot of fun
reviews.reviewText: This marble run set is a lot of fun for my toddler and even me. My wife and I enjoy building unique structures for our toddler and he loves seeing the marbles to run down the course. It is difficult for a young child to assemble by themselves but with some slight help from an adult it goes together in no problem. Plenty of pieces and marbles to make whatever course you want or you could mimic one of the three courses they provided pictures of. A great alternative to screens and provides some kinetic excitement compared to standard legos/blocks.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars We love it!
reviews.reviewText: This is easy to assemble and disassemble and my kids absolutely love it. I have a 4 year old and an 18 month old. We help them build it and they like to race marbles. My one and only issue is that our light up marbles do not roll. They constantly get stuck. I didn't take any stars off for that because the other marbles work just fine and my kids don't really care that they don't light up.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewText: It works fine for the most part. The light-up marbles that come with it don't fit in several of the tubes. Some of the bases are slightly shorter than they need to be to balance. The short runs are not half the length of the long runs, so they don't connect together easily. I wouldn't buy this brand again. I would spend the money to get a marble works brand instead.

I recently purchased this marble run set for my child, and it has quickly become a favourite in our household. This engaging toy is not only entertaining but also promotes creativity and problem-solving skills.The set comes with a variety of colorful pieces that are easy to assemble. The sturdy construction ensures stability during play, and the pieces fit together seamlessly. Watching the marbles race down the intricate tracks is a delight for both kids and adults.One of the standout features is the versatility of the set. With multiple configurations possible, my child enjoys experimenting with different designs, fostering imagination and spatial awareness. The set also includes a variety of ramps, twists, and turns, adding an element of excitement to each marble's journey.The durability of the materials is noteworthy. Despite frequent use, the pieces have held up well, and the marbles continue to roll smoothly. Cleanup is a breeze, as the pieces are easily disassembled and stored in the provided bag.Overall, this marble run set has been a fantastic addition to our playtime repertoire. It not only provides endless entertainment but also promotes essential developmental skills. If you're looking for a fun and durable toy that sparks creativity, this marble run set is an excellent choice for kids.

reviews.reviewTitle: Lots of fun for my daughter!
reviews.reviewText: First off I like how this item comes with 20 glass marbles instead of the other misleading listings that state it contains 200 amount of pieces but it's actually 60 or 80 halves of plastic balls. The tubing and pieces are good quality. The building instruction sheet is practically useless. It shows no steps and the angle of the complete set makes it hard to tell what goes where. After 30min of following the photo I realized it doesn't even come with the same pieces so either it was wrong colour or I was missing some pieces. Regardless I was able to slap it together and once completed it was great fun for the family to race the balls down the track! My daughter is only 3 so she couldn't really figure out exactly how to place the tubes together for an efficient run but it was fun doing it together.There's pros and cons to playing on carpet or hard surface. On carpet the set won't be as sturdy but on hard surface the balls easily start rolling away! It's only been a week and I've already lost 3 balls haha (I suspect they are under the fridge)I plan to re-build a big long run when I have the time. Maybe even get another set to put together in the future.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fun set. Wish it stayed together a bit better
reviews.reviewText: Lots of pieces to play with and it stays together fairly well but I do wish it stayed together a bit better.
Grandkids loved this, hours of fun, rebuild in as many ways as you can imagine
Oh my 6 and 10 year old love this. They built, broke it apart, rebuilt. Very good choice for a toy. Has a nice carry bag to store away too.
